ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: A learned a TON about London art!
An overview of art, cultural, and sociopolitical history of London.

I feel like I have a clear and solid understanding of the major artistic and cultural movements in the city of London from the 15th century to the present. I also was able to sharpen my visual analysis and reading skills, in addition to better balancing the relationship between artwork, artistic, artistic context, and larger socio-cultural context.

An understanding of British art and the art of London from the 13th century to present (notable works, artists, trends, themes, and their evolution), an understanding of the social, cultural, and political history of Britain and London, the skills for visually analyzing a work of art, and a deep, deep love for British art.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: All strengths
The exams weren't the best. They were hard to study for and kind of annoying. The papers were good for.
Amazing lectures and the most engaging sections in any art history class at Yale I've taken.
Amazing lecture  I wish it was longer!
Fantastic course and content. Would highly recommend to anybody looking to be challenged or just simply interested in art history. One of the best courses I have taken at Yale!
I absolutely loved this class. I have no criticisms. The History of Art department continues to offer time and time again the best classes Ive taken at Yale.

Best class I have taken at Yale. Only weakness was vagueness of grading on first essay and midterm exam; could not tell what was needed to improve my writing or grade. Wish the TFs had given a rubric beforehand/ more specific writing instruction/feedback on assignments and exams.

Strengths: Professor Barringer is an absolutely incredible lecturer with a wealth of knowledge. Each class was almost like a podcast. Barringer would skillfully and eloquently connecting specific works with the history of British/London art and Britain/London. The YCBA and having access to seminal works in the art of London/Britain in section and for the two papers is such a unique opportunity. Weaknesses: readings didn't always feel that useful and as a non art history major some advice on how to answer exam questions would have been helpful before the first midterm.
This course had no weaknesses! From start to finish, it was engaging, fascinating, and fun! I dont think Professor Barringer could improve it if he tried!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. Best class I've taken at Yale
Yes! Very engaging!
Absolutely. Professor Barringer is stellar and this is the art history class with the most meaningful sections, since we engage 100% of the time with the YCBA collection.
Yes, if you're interested in art it's a great way to learn! Prof. Barringer is an incredible lecturer
Yes! Please take!

I would recommend this class to everyone. The subject matter is super interesting and relevant because of the expansiveness of the British empire as well as its impact on American culture. This class is also just so much fun. Every lecture was supremely inspiring, and Professor Barringer is a phenomenal teacher.

Yes. Best class Ive taken at Yale. Barringer is a treasure, so is TF Galdone. Honor to have taken this class. Its completely changed my trajectory in my HSAR major (I am now specializing in British art).

1000000%. I'm not an art history major, and this has by far been the most enjoyable class I have ever taken in my life. I left lectures speechless. Sections consisted of looking at and discussing incredible works of art in the YCBA galleries and from its archives. For our final project, I was able to look at specific items from the collection as well. I feel I can now somewhat confidently discuss British history, art and many key artists, and I've gained such an appreciation for British art. Please take this class if you have an opportunity and are at all interested in art.
Absolutely, without question!
